data: Towards the west end of Grove Street, in Carlingford, on the shabby side of the street, stood a red brick building, presenting a pinched gable terminated by a curious little belfry, not intended for any bell, and looking not unlike a handle to lift up the edifice by to the public observation.
browsing: literature|browsing: religion/spirituality/paranormal|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: british literature
